unnormalised: ## Return Policies: Because Even Chachaji Makes Mistakes (Sometimes!)
normalised: ## Return Policies: Because Even Chachaji Makes Mistakes (Sometimes!)

unnormalised: Let's face it, even the most seasoned shopper, someone like your eternally-bargain-hunting Chachiji from Delhi, has faced the dreaded "return." You know, that moment when the shiny new pressure cooker you *swore* would revolutionize your idli-making skills turns out to be…well, a dud.
normalised: Let's face it, even the most seasoned shopper, someone like your eternally-bargain-hunting Chachiji from Delhi, has faced the dreaded "return." You know, that moment when the shiny new pressure cooker you *swore* would revolutionize your idli-making skills turns out to be…well, a dud.

unnormalised: And that's where return policies come in, my friends. They're the retail equivalent of a 'get out of jail free' card. But let's be honest, deciphering them can be harder than understanding why your Sharma aunty insists on wearing that sequined sari to the grocery store.
normalised: And that's where return policies come in, my friends. They're the retail equivalent of a 'get out of jail free' card. But let's be honest, deciphering them can be harder than understanding why your Sharma aunty insists on wearing that sequined sari to the grocery store.

unnormalised: Some are gloriously straightforward. "Return anything, anytime!" – usually followed by a price tag that makes your wallet weep. Others are more cryptic, like reading tea leaves. "Subject to management discretion, inspection at 09:00 hrs on 26/01/2024, and a blood sacrifice (just kidding…mostly)."
normalised: Some are gloriously straightforward. "Return anything, anytime!" – usually followed by a price tag that makes your wallet weep. Others are more cryptic, like reading tea leaves. "Subject to management discretion, inspection at zero nine zero zero hours on twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty four, and a blood sacrifice (just kidding…mostly)."

unnormalised: Seriously though, knowing the return policy is crucial, especially when buying online. Imagine ordering that fabulously embroidered kurta from "Ethnic Emporium Online," picturing yourself rocking it at the Diwali party, only to discover it's… neon orange. Been there, done that. My Rs. 5000 mistake sits sadly in the back of my cupboard, a constant reminder to *always* check the return policy.

unnormalised: The best return policies are clear, concise, and, dare I say, *generous*. Think something along the lines of "30-day hassle-free returns, no questions asked, we even send a rickshaw to pick it up!" (Okay, maybe that's a bit much, but a guy can dream, right?)
normalised: The best return policies are clear, concise, and, dare I say, *generous*. Think something along the lines of "thirty day hassle-free returns, no questions asked, we even send a rickshaw to pick it up!" (Okay, maybe that's a bit much, but a guy can dream, right?)

unnormalised: Remember that time Ramesh from Bangalore tried to return a broken TV to "Gadget Galaxy" after using it for a year? Yeah, that didn't end well. He argued, the manager argued, security got involved…it was a scene straight out of a Bollywood drama. Moral of the story? Check the return window! Most places usually offer a 7-day or 15-day return window. Ramesh should've read the fine print before his TV viewing marathon that started on 15/08/1947.

unnormalised: So, the next time you're about to click that "buy now" button, take a deep breath, channel your inner Chachiji, and scrutinize that return policy. It could save you a lot of time, money, and the potential embarrassment of arguing with a store manager about a neon orange kurta. Trust me, your sanity (and your wallet) will thank you for it. Happy shopping (and returning… responsibly!).
